alert.note: Alert for Clay; East Becker; East Marshall; East Polk; Kittson; Lake Of The Woods; Mahnomen; Norman; North Beltrami; North Clearwater; Pennington; Red Lake; Roseau; South Beltrami; South Clearwater; West Becker; West Marshall; West Polk; Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 23 at 6:12AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER TRAVEL IMPACTS POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY EVENING INTO FRIDAY... The first snow accumulations of the season are likely across parts of eastern North Dakota and northwest Minnesota later this week. Initially a rain show mix may develop Wednesday, with accumulating snow possibly starting Wednesday night over the Devils Lake Basin. Moderate to heavy snow develops Thursday afternoon into Friday and may impact eastern North Dakota and northwest Minnesota. There remains uncertainty regarding amounts and location of greatest impacts, but there is currently a 30 to 70 percent chance for at least minor travel impacts. The highest chances are across the Devils Lake Basin and northern Red River Valley. There is also a 30 percent chance for warning impacts due to greater than 6 inches of snowfall, primarily across the Devils Lake Basin and far northeast North Dakota. Now is the time to start preparing for the transition back to winter. Make sure your vehicle has a winter survival kit. If you have travel plans this week, closely monitor forecast updates from the National Weather Service.
